### Chinese state hackers use rootkit to hide ToneShell malware activity


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


Chinese state-sponsored hackers have developed a sophisticated rootkit to stealthily embed and conceal the ToneShell malware within infected systems. This tactic allows the attackers to maintain persistent access to compromised networks while evading detection from security mechanisms. The rootkit's primary function is to hide the presence and activity of this malware, making it challenging for cybersecurity teams to identify and address the breach. By employing these advanced techniques, the attackers can conduct prolonged espionage operations, potentially targeting sensitive data and critical infrastructure. This development highlights

### Latent Sculpting for Zero-Shot Generalization: A Manifold Learning Approach to Out-of-Distribution Anomaly Detection


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


In the article "Latent Sculpting for Zero-Shot Generalization: A Manifold Learning Approach to Out-of-Distribution Anomaly Detection," the authors introduce a novel method called Latent Sculpting, which enhances zero-shot generalization by effectively detecting anomalies in out-of-distribution data. This approach utilizes manifold learning techniques to capture the intrinsic structure of normal data, sculpting the latent space to isolate irregularities introduced by unknown distributions. By leveraging this refined understanding of the dataset's underlying manifold, the

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.22179?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_523)**

### Pruning Graphs by Adversarial Robustness Evaluation to Strengthen GNN Defenses


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a novel approach to enhancing the robustness of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) against adversarial attacks by employing adversarial robustness evaluation as a criterion for graph pruning. This method involves selectively removing potentially vulnerable edges and nodes from the network graph to fortify the GNN against malicious perturbations that could degrade its performance. By focusing on reducing the attack surfaces and refining the network structure, the approach aims to significantly bolster the resilience of GNNs, thereby improving their utility and reliability in critical

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.22128?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9021)**

### Fortinet Warns of New Attacks Exploiting Old Vulnerability


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


Fortinet has issued an alert regarding new cyberattacks that exploit an old vulnerability within their software products. Despite the availability of patches, many systems remain unupdated, leaving them susceptible to these attacks. The vulnerability in question allows attackers to execute unauthorized code, potentially leading to data breaches and system compromises. Fortinet emphasizes the importance of promptly applying security updates and maintaining a proactive security posture to safeguard against these threats. The exploitation of this outdated vulnerability highlights the ongoing risks posed by unpatched systems in the cybersecurity

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.securityweek.com/fortinet-warns-of-new-attacks-exploiting-old-vulnerability/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1072)**
